New Records: Wales and Poland drew 0-0 in regular time, with Wales winning the match 3-2 in extra time, and Poland eventually winning 5-4 in penalties
Key Match Events: James (55'), Mepham (98'), Mepham (120+1') scored for Wales, Piotrowski (50'), Zalewski (72') scored for Poland
Poland won 5-4 in penalties after the match ended 3-2 in extra time
Pre-Game Insights: Wales had a seven-match unbeaten run across all competitions and had scored in each of their last six contests, but failed to keep a clean sheet in any of their last four

Post-Match Reflections: Poland booked their tickets to Germany after winning 5-4 in penalties
Wales had their dreams of three successive appearances at the European Championships dashed
